column4: Hello Ubuntu, I want to SSH to my home machine while I am at work -- how do I set this up quickly?
you have to set up the ssh server on the work machine first
do you know of the command
what os is on the work machine?
the one I want to SSH to is ubuntu 12.04 but the one I am ssh'ing from is an android tablet
but you should do some further configuration imo
when editing the configuration files, what are some safety configurations I should be aware of?
i was looking for a good how to for you, but i can't seem to find an all encompassing one so i'll give a quick outline you can research further
I'd appreciate that greatly, |Anthony| ! Thanks for trying ^_^

1) setup pre-shared keys 2) use a passphrase 3) limit the number of allowed active ssh connections 4) change the port from the standard port 22 5) configure your os firewall (ufw) to only allow connections from the IPs you want to access it 6) do the same thing on the network firewall/router
oh and deny root access of course
4) and 5) are a bit redundant but i'm paranoid
thank you! How long should the passphrase be typically, 16-20 characters?
well... mine (for example) is about 40 character
